review: So we've been using the Xbox to get to all these apps we use but we wanted something a little more convenient that would give us quicker access.. Decided to try the roku streaming stick out because it's small and just attaches to the TV.Easy set up and your apps are right there as soon as we turn the tv on. We chose roku over the chrome one because of the TWC app. Works great, just takes a while to load up apps.The only downside to it is that the stick itself has to be plugged into an external power source. Luckily my tv has a USB port but I initially thought you just plug the stick in and that's it. Not a big deal but the cord is really long. I've seen some modified cords online that are designed for a shorter distance between the roku and usb so I'll probably look into one of those, but I wish it just came with that from the start. Also, if you plug it into a wall the roku is constantly on, cause there is no on/off, which I don't really like. At least when it's plugged into the TV it goes on and off with the TV.And unfortunately we can't use this on one of our TV's because it won't fit. The stick alone will fit but it won't fit with the cord plugged in.. So make sure it'll fit (both stick and cord) before you buy it!
author: L. Slovin
